page.title: 14LOWER SWANSEA VALLEY PROJECT
page.content:
Most of the land in our area has been reclaimed. Not so long ago, it was just slag waste from the old works but the Council cleared it and for the past 15 years trees have been planted regularly. The river, which was once polluted by industrial waste, is now full of trout and mullet. There is a new industrial area in Plasmarl but in a smokeless zone so that the land and air will not again suffer pollution.
Future developments include a hotel and leisure park. Already, the Council have made a lake called the "Pluck" which has been stocked with fish and there are seats for people to sit on. There are also nature trails through the trees.
